subject: Completeness testing in JUnit
msgSnippet: My project lead has asked me to provide a way to make ABSOLUTELY SURE that every line of code (stated as every possible code branch ) gets tested in my JUnit
messageBody:
My project lead has asked me to provide a way to make ABSOLUTELY SURE that
every line of code (stated as "every possible code branch") gets tested in
my JUnit test suites. I prefer to think in terms of the behavior of objects
and methods, not in terms of (procedural) code branches.

His first suggestion was to embed (in every method!) debug code that writes
to a log and indicates that the method was executed. I do not want to
pollute my code with piles of:

if (debug_mode) { SomeGlobalLogFile.write("this method happened") }

Any ideas on how to assure him that exhaustive testing of every outcome of
every public method will prove the system is working right?

-- Norm
